oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic and biodynamic cultivation - a possible way of increasing humus capital, improving soil fertility and providing a significant carbon sink in Nordic conditions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Granstedt, Assoc Professor Artur
Kjellenberg, L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In Sweden three different sets of long-term comparative trials have been carried out at the Biodynamic Research Institute since 1958. With biodynamic farming an average annual increase corresponding to 500 â€“ 800 kg soil carbon per ha is documented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Granstedt, Assoc Professor Artur and Kjellenberg, L. (2008) Organic and biodynamic cultivation - a possible way of increasing humus capital, improving soil fertility and providing a significant carbon sink in Nordic conditions. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
